intro: Cheiranthus jacomellii, commonly known as the Sicilian candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Sicily. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs. Cheiranthus jacomellii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and Mediterranean climates.
